history.content:
CS 188 depends on probability. So for the most part, either you should know probability ahead of time or have taken Stat 134 or something similar. I would recommend you to avoid taking CS 188 concurrently with CS 70. CS 188 tends to be in the lighter end of the CS courses and you will not get as much out of it pre-70 and you will probably find it very hard (I was going to do this last semester but decided not to because of the reasons I just mentioned). 170 is very proof based, so unless you feel comfortable with 70-level proofs you will suffer a lot. There are far many pre-reqs you can take with 70 (61b/61c/ee16a/ee16b/54, etc.). If you plan on doing ML, take 53 with 70. Or simply one of the previous ones. If you have taken them all, take 161. There's also HSS or breadth requirements. Just avoid taking classes that depend on 70 before taking it

----

I've seen people do such things with upperdivs, but I would highly recommend against such a plan. Lower division classes and prerequisites exist for a reason and popular classes like 188 and 170 aren't going anywhere in the near future. I would recommend you take lower division courses with 70, if you have any left. If you don't, I would recommend that you take an upperdiv that isn't dependent on 70 that you already cleared the prereqs for. Regardless of what you choose to do, best of luck!

———

170 yes. 188 no.

On the HKN website, I see that 70 is listed as prerequisite for 188 and 170 (among many other classes).

Would it be a good idea to take either CS188 or CS170 concurrently with CS70? What parts of 70 are needed in 188 or 170?
history.subject: CS188/CS170 with CS70
